Text.valUnicode: {\rtf1\ansi\ansicpg1252\deff0\deflang1033{\fonttbl{\f0\fnil\fcharset0 Microsoft Sans Serif;}} {\colortbl ;\red0\green0\blue0;\red255\green0\blue128;} {\*\generator Msftedit 5.41.15.1515;}\viewkind4\uc1\pard\cf1\b\f0\fs20 In this example, the user is not allowed to modify any of the fields on the table. However, the user can modify the "Filter" fields located above the table.\par \par The ability to modify a table in Magic is controlled by:\par \par 1. The \cf2 Access mode\cf1 of the Data Source (Read or Write)\par 2. The \cf2 Task Mode\cf1 of the task in focus (Modify or Create)\par 3. The \cf2 Control properties\cf1 (Allow modify and Allow Modify in Query)\par \par Here, the subtask is in Query mode, but the filter fields have \cf2 Allow Modify in Query\cf1 set to Yes. So, the user can use the filter fields to filter the table, while still using Query locate to locate one record. \par }

ExpSyntax.val: 'EN08_How Do I Prevent the End User from Modifying Any Record in a Task?'

Text.val: This task writes to two text BLOBS, then reads them into a memory table.
One table is the main display, the other is linked data.
This reads in the blob, using a ':' as a delimiter
